definition: capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: Project follow up and mile-stone report, Organizing the pilot of the new product to mass production.
sentences.chinese: 項目跟進彙報和組織新產品的試產到量產。

sentences.english: To Buy The Third Plant for an Official Mass Production of Resin Grinding Section Wheel.
sentences.chinese: 購置第三廠，正式量產樹脂法磨片切片砂輪。

sentences.english: In large-scale mass production basis to ensure better quality.
sentences.chinese: 在大規模量產的基礎上確保更優良的質量。

sentences.english: The sensor, for which Canon has announced no production plans, has a pixel count nearly 7.5 times larger than the company's highest pixel count commercially available sensor.
sentences.chinese: 對於這款傳感器，佳能公司還沒有任何量產計劃。

sentences.english: Take over product from NPI period to mbumm production period smoothly.
sentences.chinese: 在量產後重新產品導入部門順利地接收產品。

sentences.english: Transition of launch programs into volume production.
sentences.chinese: 將投產項目轉化成量產。

sentences.english: These are all thanks to "production style" animation has done.
sentences.chinese: 這些全拜“量產式”動畫所賜。

sentences.english: It was never mass-produced and was not accepted in service.
sentences.chinese: 但這個項目在設計階段就流產了，未曾量產和服役。

sentences.english: Rally Argentina will also count as round three of the Production Car World Rally Championship.
sentences.chinese: 阿根廷拉力賽也是本賽季量產車組別的第三站賽事。

sentences.english: Someone has finally mass-released solid state memory chips to replace the hard drives.
sentences.chinese: 某人終於開始量產可以取代硬碟的固態儲存晶片。

sentences.english: This paper will introduce the progressive die of the commutators for micromotor.
sentences.chinese: 本文將就微型馬達精密換向片的量產模具介紹說明。

sentences.english: Pilot run for Light Guiding Sticker and Temperature Regulator Film was completed.
sentences.chinese: 導光膜及溫度調節膜試量產完成。

sentences.english: The Nikkei business daily reported that production plans for the car had been shelved.
sentences.chinese: 《日本經濟新聞》曾報道鈴木取消了該車的量產計劃。

definition: to put into production/to put into operation
to produce/to manufacture/to give birth to a child
to leave the factory (of finished goods)
to put to use/to apply/practical/applied (science, linguistics etc)/application/practical use/(computing) app
